programme.desc: A dedicated caregiver gets her lifelong wish of having her own pool, and the pressure is on for Lucas Congdon to build a dream pool, but in a small backyard

programme.desc: The team members look for a bear-like creature known as the Silver Giant in Boone County, and build their largest trap ever. Along the way they also learn about other beasts too

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: A year in the life of Bodnant Garden in north Wales. With visitor numbers in decline, head gardener Troy Scott Smith and his manager Michael McLaren are spending £2million on a revamp, with the aim of creating one of the top 10 gardens in the world

programme.title: Dame Patricia Routledge Remembers - Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: The English actress and singer reflects on the sitcom, recalling how the character of Hyacinth Bucket first entered her life, while looking back on the part she played in bringing to life one of televisions most formidable comedy characters. She describes the pleasure of working with her fellow cast members and how, despite her fondness of the programme, she finally decided to call time on the show

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Richard is forced to think on his feet when he forgets his wedding anniversary and tells Hyacinth he has arranged to have a security alarm fitted as a present. Social-climbing comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift

programme.title: Dame Patricia Routledge Remembers - Miss Pyms Day Out
programme.desc: Patricia speaks about working on the RTS award-winning episode of the Bookmark series, in which she portrayed author Barbara Pym on the day of the 1977 Booker Prize awards. The actress shares what it was like to tell this story, from the encounters with Pyms family that were involved in the project, to reading the diary entries and letters included in the script

programme.title: Bookmark
programme.desc: Imaginative re-creation of the day in 1977 when novelist Barbara Pym travelled to London to attend the Booker Prize ceremony. Starring Patricia Routledge, with appearances from Jilly Cooper, Penelope Lively, Hilary Pym, Hazel Holt, Henry Harvey, Tom Maschler and more. First broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Dame Patricia Routledge Remembers - Talking Heads
programme.desc: The actress reflects upon her roles in Alan Bennetts acclaimed series of one-off teleplays Talking Heads. She recalls what it was like to receive the scripts that were so perfectly suited to her comic abilities, and Patricia describes the challenges of bringing the characters to life

programme.title: Talking Heads
programme.desc: A woman acting as a self-appointed Neighbourhood Watch scheme finds her habit of writing letters to the authorities is getting ridiculously out of hand. Alan Bennetts comic monologue, performed by Patricia Routledge

programme.title: Wild
programme.desc: The rich natural habitat of Bardsey Island, which lies off the Llyn peninsula, north Wales. Exploring the variety of wildlife to which it is home, particularly the thousands of unusual nocturnal birds that thrive on its environment

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: A look at a Soviet-era sanatorium on the shores of Odesa, Ukraine, where thousands arrive each summer in search of healing. Following a cast of patients and staff navigating daily life under the shadow of conflict, while they search for love, healing and happiness amidst the ongoing war close by

programme.title: Blood and Gold: The Making of Spain with Simon Sebag Montefiore
programme.desc: The historian examines Spains Golden Age under Philip II through to the Spanish Civil War and dictatorship under Franco, from which Spain has emerged as a modern democratic monarchy

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: A year in the life of Bodnant Garden in north Wales. With visitor numbers in decline, head gardener Troy Scott Smith and his manager Michael McLaren are spending £2million on a revamp, with the aim of creating one of the top 10 gardens in the world

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Richard is forced to think on his feet when he forgets his wedding anniversary and tells Hyacinth he has arranged to have a security alarm fitted as a present. Social-climbing comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift

programme.title: Bookmark
programme.desc: Imaginative re-creation of the day in 1977 when novelist Barbara Pym travelled to London to attend the Booker Prize ceremony. Starring Patricia Routledge, with appearances from Jilly Cooper, Penelope Lively, Hilary Pym, Hazel Holt, Henry Harvey, Tom Maschler and more. First broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Appealing to both adults and children alike, Philip Pullmans books have sold more than 20 million copies and been translated into 40 languages, with his recent novel La Belle Sauvage becoming an instant best-seller. Alan Yentob spends time with the author in Oxford, discovering how the former teacher became an acclaimed writer of fantasy fiction - and an outspoken critic of organised religion

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: Garden supervisor Adam Salvin restores an impressive Italianate terrace to its former glory at Bodnant Garden in north Wales, while Dave Larter shares his passion for giant lilies. The show also examines the world-famous laburnum arch in full bloom

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a 170-mile journey across the north of England. However, he soon runs into difficulty when he encounters a propeller problem in Wigan and runs aground in Blackburn. Nevertheless, he pushes on to navigate a true wonder of the waterways, the Burnley Embankment

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles continues his series charting the history of archaeological breakthroughs by looking at how discoveries in the 18th and 19th centuries overturned previously formed ideas of when and where civilisation began, as empires competed to make their beliefs prevalent

programme.title: Thatcher: A Very British Revolution
programme.desc: A look at how Margaret Thatcher and her government sought to transform the British economy with far-reaching consequences, while tensions surfaced amongst her closest allies as she tried to improve her public image and events revealed that the Iron Lady had emotional vulnerabilities in relation to her family

programme.title: Margaret
programme.desc: Lindsay Duncan stars as Margaret Thatcher in this one-off drama charting the former prime ministers final days in office. In November 1990, deputy prime minister Geoffrey Howe resigns with a speech in which he urges his fellow Conservative Party members to consider their loyalty to Mrs Thatcher. A leadership challenge is announced, but the Iron Lady refuses to take it seriously - unaware her premiership will be over just nine days later. Ian McDiarmid portrays loyal husband Denis, with Geoffrey Howe, Michael Heseltine and Kenneth Clarke played by John Sessions, Oliver Cotton and Kevin R McNally

programme.title: How to Get Ahead
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Stephen Smith explores the flamboyant court of French monarch Louis XIV at the Palace of Versailles, where he surrounded himself with aristocrats, artists, interior designers, gardeners, wig-makers, chefs and musicians. Ambitious courtiers scrambled to get closer to the king, but the bedchamber seemed to provide a more unseemly path to power

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: Garden supervisor Adam Salvin restores an impressive Italianate terrace to its former glory at Bodnant Garden in north Wales, while Dave Larter shares his passion for giant lilies. The show also examines the world-famous laburnum arch in full bloom

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Louise Minchin and Gordon Smart present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Steph McGovern reveal how a thief who killed a delivery driver in the process of trying to steal his van was eventually caught. The police also need help with another murder.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A young developer in Bushey Heath, Hertfordshire follows his mothers advice while working on a ground floor flat and an estate agent in blown away by a house in Pontypool, Monmouthshire. Two friends turn a healthy profit from transforming a terraced house in Croydon, south London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross visits the Royal Armouries Museum in Leeds to see a collection of human, horse and elephant armour, while Izzie Balmer and David Harper assist the teams in Wetherby, West Yorkshire

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Vehicle recovery specialist Richard tracks expensive farmyard vehicles stolen in broad daylight. He traces them to a scrapyard, but as he arrives, theyre on the move again

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The team searches for two lost pieces of jewellery with sentimental value and crafter Lucy Wright tries to turn a discarded ceramic pot into treasure. Social media detective Mui Abdul sends the team on the hunt for a missing teddy bear

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple find a new home in Warwickshire after six years living in the USA and now missing the UK. Jules also visits an 18th century walled garden to meet the volunteers who help keep it in tip-top condition

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts restore a carved wooden village sign made for the millennium, a handmade organ crafted from cardboard during the First World War, a rusted-up shop till that hasnt been used since the 1970s and cinema seats from the 1940s

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the quiz where contestants try to score as few points as possible. As ever, players attempt to come up with the answers no one else could think of on subjects including crime fiction, racing drivers and bells

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Lauren Laverne present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: After an odd text from Harrys phone, Teddy shares his worries with Billy. Meanwhile, Okie is fuming at Harry and insists he calls Kojo to tell him to return to the handlers. Nigel reels from his actions, Kat makes a worrying discovery, and Johnny considers a new business venture

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The documentary offers an insight into the work of frontline staff in Yorkshire. It promises to be a busy night in Bradford as the citys large Muslim community prepares to celebrate Eid. Call handler Ellie is on her final night shift before beginning her training to join the ambulance crews on the road - and before long she is guiding a worried husband through his wifes labour on the other end of the phone. Phoebe and Bailey are dispatched to Ann, who is suspected to have broken her hip in a fall after a few drinks ahead of her 80th birthday

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.sub-title: Syria to Omagh: Lost and Missing - Spotlight
programme.desc: Now living in Omagh, Emad Al Rawashdeh cannot rest until he finds his missing daughter, son and grandchildren - all vanished while trying to flee from the Middle East. Backing him is a friend who has also experienced loss - Michael Gallagher, whose son was killed in the Omagh bombing. Jennifer OLeary joins Emads search from Tyrone to his shattered home place in Syria

programme.title: In My Own Words
programme.sub-title: In My Own Words: Frederick Forsyth
programme.desc: The late thriller writer reflects on his life and tells stories of how he became the youngest ever RAF pilot, a Reuters foreign correspondent, a BBC reporter and an MI6 informant. He also shares what happened to inspire his first novel The Day of the Jackal and what it was like to become a millionaire almost overnight

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie retreats to the safety of the garage, but with a new understanding, Suz and Izzie create a unique version of Film Club to bring back Evies smile

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: The day has finally come for Noa to leave, but Evie might not let him go that easily and it is not the only big decision she has to face

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Montell Douglas, Owain Wyn Evans, Sarah Greene, Danielle Harold, Colin Jackson and Matt Morsia take part in the quiz show in which contestants and their celebrity partners must outsmart each other to win big. Hosted by Amanda Holden

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Louise Minchin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Steph McGovern reveal how an ex-prisoner who sought revenge against a guard over a petty grudge was caught. Police appeal for information on the murder of Michelle Bettles, who was killed in 2002

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In Hampshire, Jacqui Joseph visits a flat in Southsea with an interesting staircase, while Martin Roberts is in sought-after town of Cheltenham in Gloucestershire, and in Bishops Stortford in Hertfordshire, where his colourful shirt makes up for the lack of colour in a two-bedroom flat

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hosts as two teams go head to head in Greyabbey, Co Down. They are assisted in their endeavours by experts Caroline Hawley and Thomas Forrester. Along the way, Roo gets behind the wheel of a DeLorean DMC-12, the car that famously featured as a time machine in the 1985 hit movie Back to the Future. Built on the peace line in Northern Ireland, the DMC-12s design was ahead of its time with its angular, stainless steel bodywork and eye-catching gull wing doors. At the Ulster Transport Museum Roo meets two men who test-drove the first cars to come off the production line

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Trackers Neil and Jason snatch back a hire car that the customer is refusing to return. But when they search the vehicle, they make a shocking discovery

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The metal detecting team are desperate to find a treasured heirloom for a heartbroken family - lost at an ancient stone circle just north of the Lake District. Crafter Lucy tackles some rubbish, while social media detective Mui hopes to get a lost possession back on its owners wrist

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from an English coastal town find their dream country escape in Perth and Kinross with a budget of £425,000

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Richard Talman and Sonnaz Nooranvary restore a ring thats missing its original onyx stone, bought for owner Zelda by her father when she was a teenager and toy restorers Julie Tatchell and Amanda Middleditch repair a severely cracked mechanical doll. Art conservator Lucia Scalisi and textile conservator Rebecca Bissonnet join forces to fix a banner for a jazz band from the 1920s and Will Kirk repairs a handmade wooden whirligig

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones present the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The events of the accident play on Nigels mind, and Julie attempts to conceal the truth. Meanwhile, Kat follows Zoe to a clandestine meet with a private investigator to confront her about the stolen money

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Textile conservator Rebecca Bissonnet faces the challenge of restoring a Manchester United football shirt worn by a Busby Babe in the 1958 FA Cup final, while bookbinder Chris Shaw works delicately to preserve the battered pages and weathered covers of a Bible from a wartime internment camp. Munwar Hussain arrives with a beautiful but damaged Punjabi hookah once belonging to his grandfather, and brother and sister David and Lee from Huddersfield present an extraordinary automaton - a miniature watchmaker at work in his shop

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the game continues, the question on everyones lips is which celebrity was murdered, and could it lead them to a traitor? With the players growing frustrated, the mission only makes them feel even more trapped in the game and, as evening descends, the round table brings a fractious atmosphere - but will it conclude with a traitor being unveiled or lead to the loss of an innocent faithful? Hosted by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and social media

programme.title: MOTD: UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Action from the matchday three fixtures in the league phase, including Chelsea v Ajax at Stamford Bridge, Eintracht Frankfurt v Liverpool at Deutsche Bank Park, and Monaco v Tottenham Hotspur at Stade Louis II. While Spurs went into their match boasting an unbeaten record following an opening victory over Villarreal followed by a draw away to Bodø/Glimt, Chelsea and Liverpool each had a record of one win and one loss from their two previous games

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Eight celebrities who were voted off first in previous episodes are given a chance to redeem themselves and win £50,000 for charity. Susie McCabe, Joel Corry, Tim Vine, Konan, Donna Preston, Helen Flanagan, Linda Robson and Danny John-Jules take part. Romesh Ranganathan hosts

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: From singing poos to tuneful Warlords, there is something for all musical tastes and Rattus has somehow also roped Brad from the Vamps in to help him out, although rather than playing live on the main stage, Brads role seems to be more about unblocking the toilets just behind it.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Swill Gumbitz takes a look at Greek statues, the musical instrument that could make you poo yourself, and the evolution of bottom-wiping

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Exhausted, Georgie is looking forward to returning home to her fiance Jamie and her family, but the forces need her help first. However, she is shocked to the core when a desperate Elvis is forced to come clean. Starring Michelle Keegan and Luke Pasqualino

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: Quiet closes in on her search for revenge. John finds himself incapacitated. Sweet Tooth wreaks havoc during his road tour

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: Quiet reflects upon her past as she and John seek shelter from a dangerous storm in a familiar place. Quiet reflects upon her past

programme.title: Waves
programme.desc: High-school student Tyler Williams is a star athlete on the wrestling team thanks to relentless training and sparring with his domineering father, Ronald. Those dreams of excellence are threatened by Tylers shoulder injury, which he secretly deals with using prescription painkillers. Events spiral out of control when Tylers girlfriend, Alexis, learns she is pregnant and the young couple run a gauntlet of angry protesters outside an abortion clinic. Writer/director Trey Edward Shults award winning drama, starring Kelvin Harrison Jr, Lucas Hedges and Taylor Russell

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Brothers, flatmates and polar opposites Samir and Nikhil find themselves on an adventure when they accidentally steal a package from their maniac neighbour. Short, one-off comedy, starring Karan Gill, Ikky Kabir, Eshaan Akbar, Elina Saleh, Ed Kear and Andrea Valls

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie retreats to the safety of the garage, but with a new understanding, Suz and Izzie create a unique version of Film Club to bring back Evies smile

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: The day has finally come for Noa to leave, but Evie might not let him go that easily and it is not the only big decision she has to face

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Featuring Victorian fake news, paparazzi, and camera men strapped to the front of moving trains, Queen Victoria shows you how her subjects invented and became obsessed with films

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The Horrible History of dressing to kill. Henry VIII has beef over whose armour is best and Louis XV dresses as a hedge

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Sarah Keyworth hosts, as second heat contenders Eli Hart, Farhan Solo, Chloe Reynolds, Will BF and Monica Hsueh take to the stage of Birminghams Hockley Social Club in a bid to book their place in the final. Head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri is joined in her ranks by comedian, writer and podcaster Aurie Styla and local Brum stand-up Lindsey Santoro

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie retreats to the safety of the garage, but with a new understanding, Suz and Izzie create a unique version of Film Club to bring back Evies smile

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: The day has finally come for Noa to leave, but Evie might not let him go that easily and it is not the only big decision she has to face

programme.title: The Boogeyman
programme.desc: A traumatised father turns up unexpectedly at the family home of a therapist in desperate need of help. His arrival heralds the emergence of a terrifying entity that feeds on human suffering and gleefully stalks children while disbelieving parents backs are turned. Psychological horror thriller, starring Madison Hu, David Dastmalchian, Cristala Carter and Shauna Rappold

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Three film students head into the American backwoods to make a documentary about the fabled Blair Witch. There proves to be more to the urban legend than meets the eye, and as night falls they find themselves in very real danger. Horror, presented as camcorder footage shot by the characters during their investigation, starring Heather Donahue, Michael Williams and Joshua Leonard

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared, and as they reminisce, old feelings resurface. Maurice and Funmis romantic night out falls apart when they cant find a babysitter, forcing them to improvise at home - quietly, cautiously, and with one ear on the baby monitor. Over dinner, Errol finally works up the courage to ask Grace a big question - until Claude and Polly swoop in and ruin the mood. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit to the set of Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows its his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. A flawless day could launch his career, but as one mishap spirals into another, he must rely on his charm and determination to keep the production afloat - and his dream within reach. When Maurice misses yet another nursery event for Mayowa, Funmi finds an unexpected ally in a fellow parent. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena faces one final obstacle - he needs Simons help. Needless to say, getting his support comes with big strings attached. A run-in with Vanessa and her new boyfriend hits Kwabena like a ton of bricks. Maurice is blindsided when he learns that Mayowa has a girlfriend - something he knew nothing about. The revelation stings, forcing him to ask if the sacrifices hes making to fund his sons future are costing him the present. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Danielle Vitalis stars in in this comedy show exploring human exchanges and the funny unspoken rules of modern interaction. Sketches feature the driving instructor from hell, a trifling West Indian Judge and a Podcaster who will say sorry for anything if it means more money and more followers. With Vicki Pepperdine and Freddie Meredith

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: My Muddy Buddy/Mushlers To The Rescue/Shine, Lilit, Shine/Eyes On The Surprise

But Chep promises that this time he won’t.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Eyes On The Surprise/The Show Mush Go On/Mushpots Treasure/Mush-Mush The Predictor/Whos Eating Mushton/The Breathtaking...
programme.desc: Every time Mush-Mush has tried to surprise his friend with a gift, Chep has always found out what it was. But Chep promises that this time he won’t. / Mushpie loves to sing. Only problem she is terrible at it! But Lilit, who has never heard her sing before, wants to make Mushpie happy and organizes a concert for her to sing. / When Mushpot wishes he could roll back the seasons and relive being a Mushler, our friends get him to hang out doing cool Mushler stuff. / Mush-Mush can’t figure out why his sense foot keeps buzzing like crazy… until an earthquake shakes the forest. Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it! / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something. / If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Hero Trap/Bird Call/Let It Bee/The Staff Of Wisdom/The Snake Dance/Grasshopper Chep
programme.desc: The Mushlets love Mush-Mush’s heroic stories. But when they demand to see him actually do something heroic, Mush-Mush feels he can’t back out. / Chanterelle has built a whistle that can reproduce the most beautiful sound of the forest: the one of the Nightingale. / Wanting to rush off to climb Mush Mountain, Mush-Mush is in a hurry checking nectar level in flowers – a job that takes time and care. / Mush-Mush is amazed by the way Mushpot uses his staff of wisdom and how awesome it makes him look. / When Mush-Mush and Chep lose Lilit’s flying disc down a snake tunnel, he is confident he can get it back. / All the Mushables have fun zooming down a long mudslide except Chep, who just cant get up the courage to do it.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.sub-title: Bear Under Lock And Key / Lemming Blues / Snow...
programme.desc: ...Lemmings / Augmented Bear / Lemmings Under Pressure / Lemmings in Space / Sniffer Sniffler Raccoon / Transformational Bear => Unwilling to share the food both he and the Lemmings are wild about, Grizzy locks it up inside the ranger’s brand new and apparently burglar proof safe. / Grizzy is impressed by the TV show of a magician who transforms a partridge into a bouquet of flowers. / On a very hot day an ice cream commercial awakes the desire of Grizzy. / The Lemmings have discovered a truly wild new game: an augmented reality program on the rangers digital tablet. / The only edible food item left in the rangers cabin is a gorgeous salmon which is stuck inside a block of ice at the back of the freezer compartment. / The Lemmings have unearthed a box filled with birthday fountains of light that spit forth giant bursts of sparks. / Grizzys last jar of chocolate spread was pinched by the Lemmings who are savoring it in secret. / Wedged in his sofa to relieve his aching back Grizzy balks at getting up.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Star Helpers/The Rollinator/The Art of Friendship/What a Stinker/Compost to Go
programme.desc: Starmush’s back is stuck, and the Mushelder has no choice but to ask for help in Mushton. / Chep is so good at moss-marbles, no one wants to play him anymore! No one except Sumush who reveals himself to be a tough competitor. / When Chanterelle sees how good Lilit is at painting, she offers to help her dig into her talent. / Chep is very excited: tonight, a rare and extremely stinky plant is going to bloom! But he already promised Mush-Mush to play their favourite game. / When Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit take their compost meals back to their home-tree to eat, they think they have made a great new discovery.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Adventurers/Morel in the Dark/Bouncing Back/The Disappearing Mushler
programme.desc: Because Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit are always up to new adventures, Bolly has dubbed them The Adventurers. / When Mush-Mush discovers that Morel is afraid of the dark, he suggests that Chep, Lilit and he take the Mushlets to their first overnight forest camp. / Mush-Mush invents a new game called Fruity Bounce. / Mush-Mush can’t wait to show his tricks of forest illusion to everyone.

But rather than rest and avoid stress, Pep and partner Malene focused their attention on a long-held ambition to build a new house on their land in the Surrey Hills. The plan is to construct a modern take on a Viking hall, inspired by their love of all things Scandinavian and Malenes Danish heritage. Some callers are told an ambulance is being arranged when staff are actually deciding whether they need one. Targets are routinely missed. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers go on the lookout for a suspected stolen van, driven by an unlicensed and uninsured driver. Elsewhere, just north of Derby, a young driver suddenly takes off after spotting police, triggering a frantic chase

programme.desc: Coastguard helicopter rescue 936 is tasked to southwest Scotland, where a bodyboarder has been dragged out to sea in extremely rough waters. programme.title: Hangmans Knot
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers wipe out a group of Union troops carrying a shipment of gold, but later learn the Civil War ended the month before, rendering their attack a criminal act. The soldiers go on the run with the loot, but their worries deepen when they are besieged by bandits. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Richard Denning.

programme.title: The Iron Petticoat
programme.desc: A female Russian pilot defects to the West due to anger at sexual discrimination in the Soviet Air Force. A US Air Force officer tries to convince the committed communist of the benefits of life in the West and romance blossoms - but the KGB are soon stalking the couple. Comedy, starring Bob Hope, Katharine Hepburn, James Robertson Justice and Robert Helpmann

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: A tough criminal escapes from jail and hatches a scheme to rob a wealthy bookie, little realising a hardened copper is hot on his trail. Thriller, starring Stanley Baker, John Crawford, Donald Pleasence and Billie Whitelaw

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: Outlaw Robin Hood returns to England after the Crusades and goes in search of his beloved Marian, who is now an abbess, and crosses swords once again with old enemy the Sheriff of Nottingham. Medieval adventure, starring Sean Connery, Audrey Hepburn, Robert Shaw, Nicol Williamson, Ronnie Barker, Denholm Elliott and Richard Harris

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: A TV reporter investigating a presidential misdemeanour stumbles on evidence that a comet is on a collision course with Earth, threatening the future of the human race. Meanwhile, an astronaut prepares to lead his crew on a do-or-die mission to intercept the danger. Sci-fi drama, starring Robert Duvall, Tea Leoni, Morgan Freeman and Elijah Wood

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A convicted child-killer of towering height and massive build is condemned to death row, but astonishes the guards with his good nature and miraculous healing powers. They believe the gentle giant is incapable of crime, and emotions run high as they realise there is no hope of overturning his death sentence. Supernatural drama, based on a novel by Stephen King, starring Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse and Harry Dean Stanton

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: Two cattle drovers and their hired hands are looking for pasture to graze their herd, but as they pass through a backwoods town, thugs in the pay of the local sheriff try to drive them from the area. Behind the threats is a land-hungry cattle baron, but the drovers stand their ground as the rancher resorts to increasingly brutal means to intimidate them. Western, directed by and starring Kevin Costner. With Robert Duvall, Annette Bening and Michael Gambon

programme.title: Roman Holiday
programme.desc: A princess tires of a tour of European capitals and runs away from her entourage while in Rome. An American newspaper reporter takes her under his wing in the hope of getting an exclusive, but as he shows her the sights of the city, he starts to fall in love with her. Romantic comedy, starring Audrey Hepburn, Gregory Peck, Eddie Albert and Harcourt Williams

programme.title: Storm Over the Nile
programme.desc: A British Army officer resigns his commission on the eve of a campaign in Sudan to be with his fiancee. His comrades accuse him of cowardice, and when he learns his girlfriend thinks the same, he becomes determined to salvage his reputation. Disguised as an Arab, he finally has the chance to redeem himself when his friends are captured in battle. Period adventure based on The Four Feathers, with Laurence Harvey, Anthony Steel, Ronald Lewis and Mary Ure

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: An aircraft manufacturer risks alienating his friends and family in a single-minded attempt to prove planes can exceed the speed of sound. David Leans drama, written by Terence Rattigan and starring Ralph Richardson, Ann Todd, Nigel Patrick, Dinah Sheridan and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Bridge of Spies
programme.desc: A lawyer in 1950s New York is hired to represent a Soviet spy in a showcase trial designed to demonstrate the fairness of the US justice system. In the face of public condemnation, he argues against the death penalty, a stance that years later leads to his involvement in an exchange of prisoners in East Germany. Steven Spielbergs fact-based Cold War drama, starring Tom Hanks and an Oscar-winning Mark Rylance

programme.title: Bullet Train
programme.desc: Unlucky US assassin Ladybug is given a simple mission - retrieve a metal briefcase on a high-speed train departing from Tokyo. The pick-up is too easy, but Ladybug discovers that four other killers are on board the same train, and that their missions have something in common. John Wick director David Leitchs comedy thriller, starring Brad Pitt, Joey King, Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Sandra Bullock

programme.title: Were All Going to the Worlds Fair
programme.desc: When a teen gets drawn into an online role-playing game, the lines between truth and fiction start to blur. Coming-of-age horror, starring Anna Cobb

programme.title: Kill List
programme.desc: A hitman with money worries is persuaded by his old partner to take on one last job. The duos mysterious client presents them with a list of three targets, but as they go about their deadly work, they start to realise there is something far more disturbing going on than a simple act of murder. Thriller, with Neil Maskell, Michael Smiley and MyAnna Buring

Action thriller based on the Marvel comic-book, starring Ray Stevenson, Dominic West and Doug Hutchison.

Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr, Rupert Vansittart and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a woman is drowned in a bath and made to look like a bride, with a chilling lipstick message on the bathroom mirror, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-policeman and former brothel madam as they try to identify the killer. Guest starring Pam Ferris (Rosemary and Thyme) and Kacey Ainsworth (formerly EastEnders Little Mo)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A serial killer begins targeting members of a religious group that claims to provide guidance for lost souls. As the investigation proceeds, it becomes clear that Hathaway, who once trained for the priesthood, knows more about the case than he is willing to reveal - causing Lewis to consider him as a suspect. Guest starring Ian McNeice and Rachael Stirling alongside Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: The murder of two youngsters in ritual slayings lead the police into a case of black magic - and things soon become more incredible, from animal sacrifices and paintings in blood to two of the team apparently cursed by voodoo dolls. Tony remains sceptical throughout - until Alex and her son become the killers next targets. Thriller, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib

programme.desc: Perdy and Gray discuss Katies offer, but Chas tries to warn the girl that her crush may be affecting her judgement. Zak and Lisa discover Sam is planning on leaving home.

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Joan bids a fond farewell to her friends at the hospital, but a last-minute intervention by her mother makes her reconsider her decision to leave. Meanwhile, Carnegie courts a wealthy patient in the hope of raising funds for the new hospital wing, and an alcoholic lets his family down at the worst possible moment. Hospital drama, starring Kananu Kirimi and Robert Cavanah

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Aidensfield residents are shocked when an MI5 agent turns up in the village showing more than just a passing interest in the activities of Vernon Scripps and his mysterious associate, a man who disembarked from a Russian trawler docked in Whitby harbour. programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Sam decides to have a housewarming party - but things quickly get out of control. Marlon accidentally shares his frustrations about his marriage with the regulars of the Woolpack.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Leanne feels guilty when she learns Roger has invested all his savings in the restaurant, while Ashley invites Casey for a drink. Joanne threatens Carla and Liam with a tribunal.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Vernon prepares to jet off to Spain - so Liz makes a heartfelt plea for him to take her with him. Leanne turns to Carla for help again and Jason is unhappy to see Eileen with Pat.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Its a happy day for Downton as Annas patience is rewarded, while Edith receives admiration from an unexpected quarter. Matthew refuses to back down over the estate management, but will his tactics pay off? Bransons plan for the christening causes consternation, as does the arrival of his brother, and OBriens motives are unclear as she counsels Thomas. Julian Fellowes period drama, starring Joanne Froggatt, Laura Carmichael, Dan Stevens and Allen Leech

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa and Martin search for a nursery now that Janice has left, and Mrs Tishell is shocked to find out that Al has very high blood pressure. Louisa also helps with the diagnosis of a pupil, which spurs her on to explore the possibilities of a change of career. This is not welcome news for Martin, who dislikes any kind of change, even if it could be for the better. Elsewhere, Ruth is approached about selling her farm. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz, Selina Cadell and Ian McNeice

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A spate of petty thefts is traced to a local nursing home, but Blaketons investigations uncover something far more sinister. Meanwhile, Davids first day in his new job goes spectacularly wrong, but Bernie is not surprised. Rural drama, starring Jason Durr and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ashfordly Hall throws open its doors to the public, but all hell breaks loose when a collection of valuable Constable sketches is stolen. Mike and Tom are sent to question the chief suspect, an 80-year-old art thief, only to find him mugged and bound to a chair - with none of the paintings anywhere in sight. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr and Ryan Early

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A mother of two is found murdered in her back garden. Vera and Aiden investigate the case, and delve into the disturbing secrets and ongoing conflicts that lurk beneath the surface of the victims seemingly peaceful suburban community. The case takes a more complicated turn when the dead womans estranged family make an unexpected reappearance, and while several of her neighbours may have had cause to carry out a crime of passion, her relatives may have had compelling motives of their own to kill. Guest starring Rita Tushingham

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective discovers his favourite 1970s band are on the verge of a comeback - along with their singer Esme Ford, who has made a shocking reappearance from beyond the grave, having faked her own death 35 years earlier. But when an orphan is found dead on the other side of town, a forensic link leads Lewis and Hathaway to suspect the aged rockers are somehow involved. Joanna Lumley, David Hayman, Simon Callow and Helen Baxendale guest star alongside Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Two successful career women are found raped and strangled in imitation of similar murders years earlier in continental Europe. Tony picks up the links with Bradfields own business community, but his investigations are interrupted by the unexpected arrival of teenage killer Jack Norton, who is on the run from his social workers because he cannot cope with life `released under licence"

Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Serhat Ahmet tour East Anglia hunting for antiques. As their quest continues, Serhat meets the great nephew of a woman who broke the social norms of the day to go to fight on the front line. Catherine, meanwhile, gets to sample a local delicacy that sounds rather unappealing, but has sustained the local population for centuries. The competing duo then head to a picturesque spot by a windmill to watch their items go under the hammer at auction

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: As their quest for bargains continues, Serhat Ahmet is on the hunt once more for ceramics, while Catherine Southon has her eye on a more eclectic mix of items. Serhat makes some new four-legged friends and finds out about a refugee fleeing his war-torn country who became a local legend in his adopted home town thanks to his crazy stunts and feats of strength. Catherine also gets a taste of a high-speed motorsport and goes for a ride from which she might never recover

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell return with more stories of people who were abandoned as babies, helping them try to find their birth families and know their identities. For a man left as a baby on church steps more than 50 years ago, there are shocking revelations when a long-held family secret is finally uncovered, while a young woman who was discovered in hospital toilets in the 1980s receives some surprising news that deepens the mystery of her beginnings

Steve Austin and Moira Tonge only found each other as adults, but then at their mothers funeral discovered they also had an older sister. Lisa Irvine also only found out about her brother Nicholas as an adult, when she read her adoption paperwork and wants to know what happened to him and her birth mother

programme.desc: Drew Pritchard buy quirky items in Dorset. Twin sisters show their late fathers legacy - vintage cars and steam train memorabilia. Plus, a visit to Lutons oldest hat makers

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard explores an Aladdins cave of magic carpets in Cumbria and royal biographer Lady Colin Campbell reveals antiques with tragic history from her romantic castle

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard locks horns with a fellow dealer over a buffalos skull in Oxfordshire. Plus, a private girls school in Hertfordshire seeks top marks for its haul of furniture

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple with a £600,000 budget search for a country home in Dorset with the potential to generate income. Away from the hunt, the presenter discovers how to make a traditional shepherds hut

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson brings his enthusiasm and rural property expertise to the North Wessex Downs as he helps a couple who have £775,000 to find a characterful country house. Whilst in the area, Jules also pays a visit to Highclere Castle to learn about the fascinating foreign finds within the walls of the impressive Wiltshire home

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Tee John are invited to a private motor museum in Denbighshire. This fascinating collection boasts a steel plate Castrol sign and a charming pedal car

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore scours boots full of rubbish in Buckinghamshire, picking out an oak storage cabinet, three wooden bar stools and a collection of geo boards

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The Isle of Skye hosts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill, where a sweet bonbon dish and a collection of glass go to auction while a clan chieftains secret weapon is revealed. As the last auction approaches, it remains to be seen whether Mark will win his debut trip - or whether Roo will manage to snatch victory at the last

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer and James Braxton kick off a new adventure in South Wales, Izzie decides to buy a monkey-shaped 1920s perfume bottle, while James cannot resist a bamboo table

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.sub-title: Ringing Bells and a Rare Watch
programme.desc: Angus helps a grieving daughter clear her late mums huge collection of bells. Another job sees a room emptied for the first time in 50 years

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: A cancer survivor calls on Angus to sell family heirlooms to fund an around the world trip. Elsewhere, a coin collection makes a mint at auction

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Serhat Ahmet and Catherine Southon start the final lap of their antiques race on the bumpy backroads of Lincolnshire, heading to their final destination of Silverstone - the home of the British Grand Prix - in Northamptonshire. On their travels, Catherine discovers the history of the most iconic of classical instruments at a school that teaches students how to make them. Meanwhile, Serhat hears the story of how a group of enterprising 18th-century miners helped turn a peak in Derbyshire into one of the countrys earliest tourist attractions

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Dealers Paul Martin and Margie Cooper set off on a bargain-hunting trip through Somerset, picking up tribal art and Edwardian furniture along the way

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The contestants are asked to insert an invisible zip and pockets on a pair of palazzo pants, while the judges keep a keen eye on how well they pattern-match the bold prints. For the transformation challenge, the sewers must turn towels into stylish beach cover-ups in just 90 minutes. Male models arrive in the Sewing Room for the final challenge, ready to be fitted with a made-to-measure holiday shirt using bright and colourful fabrics. Whose shirt will bring on the sunshine, and who will be sent packing?

programme.title: Adam Richman Eats Britain
programme.desc: Adam heads to Kent to try a very special sandwich in Sandwich. There, he also tries Whitstable oysters, traditional fish and chips, and a new baked sensation, the cruffin

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Belindas lump on her neck causes her to be immobile, and Nicole will not get married until she gets her arm pit lump removed. Meanwhile, Nick unwisely removed a lipoma at home

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Kika is a golden labrador and a guide dog for her owner Dr Amit, who is blind, which means he cannot see. She is trained to use her super sight to help Dr Amit do as many things as he can by himself. Together, they make the best team! Dr Amit is off to the florists to buy some flowers for his wife, Seema. To help him get there, Kika enlists the help of top secret bumpy bits, the system of clever dots and lines on the pavement that humans call tactile paving. As they navigate their way over a zebra crossing, along a footpath next to a cycle lane, down a stairway near the station and across the road at a pelican crossing, with its top secret spinning cone, Kika explains how the different bumpy bits help her and Dr Amit find their way around town. Its like reading a secret code. Dr Amit wears shoes that he can feel the different bumps through. And when he finds shoes that are good for the bumps, he buys five pairs! But on their way back from the florists, Kika finds their path blocked. Can she use her super sight find a new way home in time to give Seema her flowers?

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Dan the border collie is a search and rescue dog who works with his owner Jamie. His super nose follows scents and smells like clues so they can rescue people who need their help. Dan is busy digging a hole when his owner Jamie gets a very important phone call - police officer Penny needs them to go to Woofton Woods to look for a lost birdwatcher who is out trying to spot a rare bird, the Woofton woodpecker. After locating the birdwatchers car, Dan has to find the scent to discover which of the many paths she has taken through the woods. But the scent takes them off the path and into the canopy of trees, which are full of low-hanging branches and logs. Jamie kits Dan up with his breeze-busting bell so that he can hear him in the thicker forest. But after tracking down the lost birdwatcher, Dan and Jamie head back to the car park only to discover her car is still there. The birdwatcher has gone missing again! Can Dan and Jamie complete a double rescue?

Back in Chicago, Capones new enforcer Mike DAngelo puts the wheels in motion to recoup the money that was lost during a government raid - and Eli and Van Alden are tasked with the job. A series of flashbacks reveal a younger Nucky in 1884 as he comes to terms with his sisters death in the shadow of his fathers stand-off with the Commodore
